p: Flavivirus genus, including DENV, yellow fever virus, Japanese encephalitis virus, and WNV, have caused countless infections for decades and posed a serious threat to public health in the world [ 21]. ZIKV also belongs to the Flavivirus genus. Discovery of ZIKV was first noticed in Uganda in 1947, but only sporadic ZIKV infections were reported until its outbreak in Micronesia [ 1, 2]. To date, ZIKV is spreading globally and the occurrence of ZIKV infection is reported around the world, which raises global concern. Despite observing ZIKV infections in 12 South and Southeast Asian countries, current knowledge about ZIKV especially in East Asia and China, is still limited.
